intro: Begonia tandangii, commonly known as the Tandang begonia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves that are often a deep green with a reddish or purple tinge. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of pink or white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in shady, humid environments and prefers well-draining soil. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sought-after species among plant enthusiasts.
